job_title: Home Care RN in Attleboro, MA
pros: Quality care for the clients and very supportive of the staff.
cons: There are no cons to mention

job_title: Marketing & Development Assistant in Attleboro, MA
pros: Management is very supportive and open to new ideas. The leadership team is exceptional! Great place to work!

review_title: Talking the Talk & Walking the Walk
pros:
Community VNA is an organization that lives and breathes its mission. As a non profit healthcare organization in business for more than 100 years the agency is dedicated to enhancing the health, wellness and quality of life in the communities we serve.

Many organizations talk about taking care of the very community that often contributes to their success -- their employees.

From the moment of my first interview I had the impression I was joining a family. Life-work balance is something that is not only talked about, but highly encouraged. There is evidence throughout the workplace that values and reinforces collaboration as well as compassion. From career training to career advancement opportunities, from internal communication to recognition opportunities, from the suggestion box to the strategic plan -- all voices and ideas are welcomed.
Insurance, there truly isn’t any. The insurance was the only thing good. The pay is lousy.
cons: The worst uneducated bunch of backstabbers I’ve ever seen and this isn’t the coworkers it’s the old fashioned good ole boy mgt. They are putting false reviews on the web sites making it look good, discrimination, lying, hateful, bullying, toxic work environment is rampant. Fat unhealthy undereducated nurses and therapists who call themselves mgt. Get rid of paying for bloated middle mgt who are hangers on who do absolutely nothing. If you do get hired, do not go to Seattle for training it’s nothing but hateful, mean spirited, gossips who will gossip to the Spokane bunch. The middle mgt is committing criminal conduct and their HR is a joke. The lying, sleeziness is going to catch up. Licenses need to be yanked for this type of conduct. Don’t work here. High turnover, unstable job. You’ll just waste your time and quit anyway.

job_title: Community Relations and Fund Development Manager in Attleboro, MA
pros:
As a community-based, non-profit, healthcare organization, Community VNA provides compassionate care for the patients and families it serves. More importantly, the company has a culture that is immediately palpable. The company cares deeply about its employees, promoting the importance of maintaining a healthy life-work balance. Additionally, the work environment is one that honors and respects collegiality, collaboration, and cooperation. Great value is given to honoring a multitude of thoughts and opinions.  

I have worked for a variety of organizations including both small and large non profit organizations; private and public liberals arts colleges; as well as private and public healthcare organizations. Where benefits are concerned, Community VNA offers a package that is highly competitive and rewarding to its employees.

review_title: Stands Behind its Mission and its Employees
pros: The Agency cares not only for their clients but also for their employees.  Compensation is competitive with other agencies in the area.  They stand behind their mission  and give back to the community it serves.   Community VNA has been in operation for well over one hundred years and many of its employees have worked here over 20 years.
cons: Can't think of any right now

pros: Community VNA is a great place to work.  It is a well run organization that believes in its mission and staff.  I have been here for over 25 years and have always been supported in my role.  I am proud to say that I am part of the Community VNA family.
cons: I can not think of any cons.

pros: Co-workers and Senior Management are awesome!  Supportive, friendly, and it is a pleasure to work with each of them.
cons: Occasionally parking space in the lot is an issue, but there is also plenty of street parking and alternate parking areas are available.
staff support, no perks for seniority
